name: sluggishly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a sluggish way (= moving or operating more slowly than usual and with less energy): The band played sluggishly and appeared bored. The stream runs sluggishly down from the hills in the April heat before the arrival of the June monsoon. See
sluggish
More examplesFewer examplesThe economy will grow only sluggishly or actually contract from January through June.Walking briskly, not sluggishly, in fresh air is still the best all-round exercise. The traffic was moving sluggishly along the road in the direction of the City Centre.
